review: The advertising only talks about the amazingly simple installation and function. Not true. There are multiple reasons  why it will be incompatible with the router.These cannot be fixed without expertise.The device then does not function.Dont buy it.
author: Andrew

review: Just as advertised. Limited in its capabilities but still useful. If you were looking for something to beam or mirror from your phone this isn't it. For the average user this will be magic!
author: JAG

review: Very happy with it. Easy to use with an Android phone. Enjoy streaming from Netflix and Youtube. I love it!
author: Lon

review: Its nice for the price.  It's cool to cast youtube and netflix, but you can't really cast anything else.  Give it a year and see if HBOGo supports it in the native app, then it great!
author: Jonathan T. Bishop

review: Need to add more apps.  I can get youtube and Netflix on game consoles and blue-ray DVD.  Guess I was expecting more access.  Using device with my iPadDecember 25, 2013 UPDATE!!! - with the addition of the new apps (including Hulu, hBO GO, Pandora, etc)  I am now thoroughly enjoying my Google ChromeCast HDMI Streaming Media Player!  A must-have!
author: Katherine Corbett

review: The chrome cast sounded like it would be very useful being able to stream right to the TV from your laptop, but once I got it workingit only streams a couple services not what ever you want.Disappointed with its capabilities
author: Robert L Hudson

review: I purchased the Chromecast directly from Google. It's the best thing ever to use with my Motorola Droid. Works great with Android tablet. It's really nice that you don't have to fumble for the remote control. The best is the "YouTube" usage is better than Roku. The best thing is you can type the smartphone keyboard easier than the remote control. The price point is unbeatable. I really like the portability of this device. Just unplug and slip in pocket and ready to go.
author: PKS "Laughing Buddha"

review: Well this thing has been covered to death on the trade sites so I'll just hit the highlights.If you need a media streamer this is a great one at a great price and it's only going to get better as more stuff is developed for it. It powers easily through an outlet with the included power adapter or you can power it from the TV with the included USB cable. It plugs directly into an HDMI port and it comes with a cord that lets it hang if you are in a tight spot. It is fairly small when compared to the competition and lastly it sets up in about a minute.
author: Get Back Jojo "manard"

review: I have been using this for a few weeks now.  As far as streaming youtube and netflix is concerned this does the best job among all its competitors in the market. It is so unbelievably easy to use and streams in full HD quality as promised. Also very easy to operate the apps themselves via mobile devices. Frankly, the amount of time I spent in front of my TV has increased many fold since I bought this.The next big step would be effective wireless HDMI transfer of chrome tabs from the browser on a PC to the TV. I assume that it would take some time given the extreme heterogeneity of the content to be streamed.
author: S. Dutta

review: Based on what I read in mktg matls, I expected to be able to use this device to view Amazon Prime movies.  I may have made a small leap in expecting this, however, it said selected content viewable on Chrome on your PC.  Oh well, it works just fine for Netflix (which I was able to try it on with my son's account.  I just ended up feeling a little mislead.  I would encourage Google to make it work with Amazon Prime movies.
author: Charger
